newsitem.title: PERU: Peru rebel leader sees no quick solution to crisis.
newsitem.headline: Peru rebel leader sees no quick solution to crisis.

text.p: The leader of Peruvian guerrillas holding 83 hostages at the Japanese ambassador's residence in Lima said on Tuesday he did not foresee a quick solution to the two-week-old crisis.
"I do not see an immediate solution," Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) leader Nestor Cerpa Cartolini told reporters allowed into the residence.
He said he was "open to any mediator ... (Cuban leader Fidel) Castro or (Russian President) Boris Yeltsin or whoever."
The rebels' key hostage, Peruvian Foreign Minister Francisco Tudela, also speaking to reporters inside the residence, called for a peaceful solution to the crisis.
"The country should direct itself to a peaceful situation," he said, adding that he was not taking part in negotiations.
Earlier, President Alberto Fujimori and his Prime Minister Alberto Pandolfi both expressed confidence that the crisis would be brought to a peaceful end.
